summary.span: 实现数字显示框（也称为 up-down 控件）所需的基本功能。

span.span: Implements the basic functionality required by a spin box (also known as an up-down control).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 数字显示框由一个文本框和一个小垂直滚动条组成，通常称为数值调节钮控件。A spin box consists of a text box and a small vertical scroll bar, commonly referred to as a spin button control. 类链接这两个控件，并允许用户通过单击向上或向下按钮或直接在文本框中输入适当类型的值，来更改文本框中的显示内容。The class links the two controls and allows the user to change the display in the text box by clicking the up or down buttons or by entering the appropriate type of value directly into the text box. 如果要限制用户可以选择的值列表，请使用数字调整框，类似于列表框或组合框。Use the spin box in cases where you want to limit the list of values a user can select, similar to a list box or combo box. 根据要显示的列表的类型，使用数字显示框的优势在于，它允许快速设置有效值的范围，而不是一次添加一个值。Depending upon the type of list you want to display, the advantage to using a spin box is that it allows you to quickly set a range of valid values, rather than adding items one at a time. 实现数字显示框需要的数据验证比文本框少，因为从 派生类时可以限制数据类型。Implementing a spin box requires less data validation than a text box, as you can limit the data type when you derive a class from . 这是 类的一个示例，它将值限制为数值类型，并使用 和 属性来验证数据。An example of this is the class, which limits the values to the numeric type and uses a and property to validate the data. 若要允许用户使用箭头键更改数字显示框的内容，请将 属性设置为 `true`。To allow the user to use the arrow keys to change the contents of a spin box, set the property to `true`. 若要将用户限制为指定的值，请将 属性设置为 `true`。To restrict the user to values you specify, set the property to `true`. 若要在数字显示框中控制文本的对齐方式，请设置 属性。To control the alignment of text in the spin box, set the property. 若要设置与控件的文本框部分相关的向上和向下按钮的对齐方式，请将 属性设置为 或 。To set the alignment of the up and down buttons in relation to the text box portion of the control, set the property to either or . 和 方法在被重写时，处理单击向上或向下按钮。The and methods, when overridden, handle the clicking of the up or down buttons. 重写时， 和 方法验证值（已选择或输入），并更新数字显示框中显示的文本。When overridden, the and methods validate the value (either selected or entered) and update the text displayed in the spin box. 如果值验证失败，请使用 方法选择无效文本。If the value fails validation, use the method to select the text that is not valid. 这样，用户就可以快速更正文本，只需键入新值，就不必手动选择或删除现有文本。This allows the user to quickly correct the text by simply typing in a new value without having to manually select or delete the existing text. 从 .NET Framework 4.6 开始，当 app.config 文件包含以下项时，将根据系统 DPI 设置调整 控件的大小：Starting with the .NET Framework 4.6, the control will be resized based on the system DPI setting when the app.config file contains the following entry: ```   ``` ## Examples 下面的代码示例使用派生类 并设置派生自 的部分属性。The following code example uses the derived class and sets some of its properties derived from . 此代码要求你有一个名为 `numericUpDown1`的 控件、两个名为 `comboBox1` 和 `comboBox2`的 控件以及在窗体上创建的名为 、`checkBox1`和 `checkBox2`的三个 `checkBox2` 控件。This code requires that you have a control named `numericUpDown1`, two controls named `comboBox1` and `comboBox2`, and three controls named `checkBox1`, `checkBox2`, and `checkBox2` created on a form. 将以下项添加到 `comboBox1`： `None`、`Fixed3D`和 `FixedSingle`。Add the following items to `comboBox1`: `None`, `Fixed3D`, and `FixedSingle`. 将以下项添加到 `comboBox2`： `Left`、`Right`和 `Center`。Add the following items to `comboBox2`: `Left`, `Right`, and `Center`. 代码允许您在运行时更改属性值，并查看每个属性值如何影响数字显示框的外观和行为。The code allows you to change the property values at run time and see how each affects the appearance and behavior of the spin box. remarks.format: ## Remarks 有关处理事件的详细信息，请参阅[处理和引发事件](~/docs/standard/events/index.md)。For more information about handling events, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/docs/standard/events/index.md). ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何使用此成员。The following code example demonstrates the use of this member. 在此示例中，事件处理程序报告 事件的发生。In the example, an event handler reports on the occurrence of the event. 此报表可帮助你了解何时发生事件，并可帮助你进行调试。This report helps you to learn when the event occurs and can assist you in debugging. 若要报告多个事件或频繁发生的事件，请考虑将 替换为 或将消息附加到多行 中。To report on multiple events or on events that occur frequently, consider replacing with or appending the message to a multiline . 若要运行示例代码，请将其粘贴到一个项目中，该项目包含继承自 的类型的实例，如 或 。To run the example code, paste it into a project that contains an instance of a type that inherits from , such as a or . 然后，将该实例命名为 `UpDownBase1` 并确保事件处理程序与 事件关联。Then name the instance `UpDownBase1` and ensure that the event handler is associated with the event. remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果 属性设置为 "`true`，数字显示框（也称为 up-down 控件）具有焦点，则用户可以使用向上键和向下键选择值。If the property is set to `true` and the spin box (also known as an up-down control) has focus, the user can use the UP ARROW and DOWN ARROW keys to select values. ## Examples 下面的代码示例使用派生类 并设置派生自 的部分属性。The following code example uses the derived class and sets some of its properties derived from . 此代码要求你有一个名为 `numericUpDown1`的 控件、两个名为 `comboBox1` 和 `comboBox2`的 控件以及在窗体上创建的名为 、`checkBox1`和 `checkBox2`的三个 `checkBox2` 控件。This code requires that you have a control named `numericUpDown1`, two controls named `comboBox1` and `comboBox2`, and three controls named `checkBox1`, `checkBox2`, and `checkBox2` created on a form. 将以下项添加到 `comboBox1`： `None`、`Fixed3D`和 `FixedSingle`。Add the following items to `comboBox1`: `None`, `Fixed3D`, and `FixedSingle`. 将以下项添加到 `comboBox2`： `Left`、`Right`和 `Center`。Add the following items to `comboBox2`: `Left`, `Right`, and `Center`. 代码允许您在运行时更改属性值，并查看每个属性值如何影响数字显示框的外观和行为。The code allows you to change the property values at run time and see how each affects the appearance and behavior of the spin box. remarks.format: ## Remarks 引发事件时，将通过委托调用事件处理程序。Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate. 有关详细信息，请参阅[处理和引发事件](~/docs/standard/events/index.md)。For more information, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/docs/standard/events/index.md). 方法还允许派生类对事件进行处理而不必附加委托。The method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. 这是在派生类中处理事件的首选技术。This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

para.span: 在派生类中重写 时，一定要调用基类的 方法，以便已注册的委托对事件进行接收。

span.span: When overriding in a derived class, be sure to call the base class's method so that registered delegates receive the event.
